arm_group.description: teeth molding in subjects without congenital fourth nerve palsy
teeth molding in patients suffering from congenital fourth nerve palsy

brief_summary.textblock:
Patients suffering from congenital fourth cranial nerve palsy may have misalignment of jaws
      as well as teeth due to head tilt in childhood.

clinical_study.brief_title: Teeth and Jaw Misalignment in Patients Suffering From Congenital Fourth Cranial Nerve Palsy

detailed_description.textblock:
Measurement of teeth and jaw parameters in patients suffering from congenital fourth cranial
      nerve palsy compared to patients without fourth cranial nerve palsy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  unilateral congenital fourth nerve palsy

          -  natural teeth occlusion

          -  age > 18 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  bilateral fourth nerve palsy

          -  no natural teeth occlusion

study_pop.textblock: patients suffering from congenital fourth nerve palsy

intervention.description: teeth molding in patients suffering from congenital fourth nerve palsy

link.description: official homepage of swiss federal government

clinical_study.official_title: Teeth and Jaw Misalignment in Patients Suffering From Congenital Fourth Cranial Nerve Palsy

oversight_info.authority: Switzerland: Federal Office of Public Health

primary_outcome.description: The angle between teeth positions from upper and lower jaw will be measured using teeth molding.
primary_outcome.measure: angle between teeth positions from upper and lower jaw

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
